hasDitaContent.@value: Both inotuzumab ozogamicin and amifampridine prolong the QT interval. Most manufacturers advise avoiding the use of two or more drugs that are associated with QT prolongation. Increasing age, female sex, cardiac disease, and some metabolic disturbances (notably hypokalaemia) predispose to QT prolongation.

hasDitaContent.@value: Both inotuzumab ozogamicin and lapatinib prolong the QT interval. Most manufacturers advise avoiding the use of two or more drugs that are associated with QT prolongation. Increasing age, female sex, cardiac disease, and some metabolic disturbances (notably hypokalaemia) predispose to QT prolongation.

hasMessage.hasTextContent: Xipamide   is predicted to   cause   hypokalaemia (potentially increasing the risk of torsade de pointes) when given with   inotuzumab ozogamicin .  Manufacturer makes no recommendation .

hasDitaContent.@value: Yellow fever vaccine, live is predicted to increase the risk of generalised infection (possibly life-threatening) when given with inotuzumab ozogamicin. Public Health England advises avoid (refer to Green Book).

hasMessage.hasTextContent: Yellow fever vaccine, live   is predicted to   increase   the risk of generalised infection (possibly life-threatening) when given with   inotuzumab ozogamicin .  Public Health England advises avoid (refer to Green Book) .

hasDitaContent.@value: Both inotuzumab ozogamicin and zuclopenthixol prolong the QT interval. Most manufacturers advise avoiding the use of two or more drugs that are associated with QT prolongation. Increasing age, female sex, cardiac disease, and some metabolic disturbances (notably hypokalaemia) predispose to QT prolongation.

hasMessage.hasTextContent: Both  inotuzumab ozogamicin  and  zuclopenthixol  prolong the QT interval. Most manufacturers advise avoiding the use of two or more drugs that are associated with QT prolongation. Increasing age, female sex, cardiac disease, and some metabolic disturbances (notably hypokalaemia) predispose to QT prolongation.
